scenarioDescription:
The HD 18015 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 18015 is a star with 1.49 times the mass of the Sun, and 3.13 times its radius. It is located 403.78 light years away from the solar system.

HD 18015 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 18015 system


HD 18015 b

HD 18015 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2019-04, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.87 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 18015 b is 1011.240 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 18015 b is 13.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 18015 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 18015, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 18015 - System With 1 Exoplanet
